sections.title: São Paulo Specific Context
paragraphs: Each Brazilian state has unique characteristics. We understand the specific requirements and procedures for São Paulo and can guide you accordingly.

sections.title: Apply Now for Tourist Visa
paragraphs: Get started with your tourist visa application today.

sections.title: Who needs a visa and who does not
paragraphs: Visa requirements depend on nationality. Some travelers can enter visa-free for short stays, while others must apply in advance. Always confirm with the Brazilian consulate for your country before booking travel.

What people get wrong:
assuming previous entry guarantees future entry, or arriving without proof of onward travel.

sections.title: Entry procedures and border checks
paragraphs: On arrival, you may be asked for your purpose of visit, accommodation details, and proof of funds. Border officials can deny entry even with a valid visa.

sections.title: Length of stay and conditions
paragraphs: Short-stay permissions are typically limited to 90 days within a 180-day period, unless your visa specifies otherwise. Extensions are not automatic and must be requested before expiration.

sections.title: Arrival logistics in São Paulo
paragraphs: Most arrivals use airports in São Paulo or nearby hubs. Expect customs checks and luggage screening. Keep copies of travel insurance and accommodation confirmations.

sections.title: What you can and cannot do legally
paragraphs: Tourist or visitor status does not allow employment, paid services, or long-term study. Violations can lead to fines, removal, or entry bans.

sections.title: Frequently asked questions
paragraphs: In most cases, changes must be initiated from abroad or require strict eligibility. Do not assume you can switch after arrival.
You must exit before the authorized stay ends. Overstays can affect future eligibility.
Passport, proof of funds, return or onward ticket, and accommodation details are commonly requested.
Can I change status after entering as a tourist?
What if my flight is delayed past my stay limit?
What documents should I carry?
Can I change status after entering as a tourist? In most cases, changes must be initiated from abroad or require strict eligibility. Do not assume you can switch after arrival.
What if my flight is delayed past my stay limit? You must exit before the authorized stay ends. Overstays can affect future eligibility.
What documents should I carry? Passport, proof of funds, return or onward ticket, and accommodation details are commonly requested.

sections.title: What happens next
paragraphs: If you plan to relocate or apply for a longer-term visa, start documentation early and confirm eligibility before your visit ends.

sections.title: Compliance disclaimer
paragraphs: This content is informational only and does not guarantee entry or visa approval. Entry decisions are discretionary and subject to change.

sections.title: Border interview preparation
paragraphs: Prepare a concise explanation of your visit, length of stay, and address. Border officers may ask for proof of funds, return tickets, and accommodation.

What people get wrong:
giving inconsistent answers or presenting unclear travel plans.

sections.title: Customs and restricted items
paragraphs: Declare items that may exceed personal allowance or require documentation. Always check current customs limits before arrival.

sections.title: What happens next
paragraphs: If your goal is relocation, start preparing documents during your visit, but plan to apply from the correct jurisdiction.

sections.title: Compliance disclaimer
paragraphs: Entry rules are subject to change and are enforced at the discretion of border authorities.

sections.title: Entry interview examples
paragraphs: Be ready to answer where you will stay, how long you plan to remain, and how you will fund your trip. Keep consistent answers with your booking documents.

sections.title: Common compliance missteps
paragraphs: Working remotely for a foreign employer while on tourist status.
Overstaying by even a few days.
Entering with unclear or conflicting travel plans.

sections.title: What happens next
paragraphs: If you intend to apply for a long-term category, return home and prepare the correct consular application rather than attempting to change status on arrival.

sections.title: Compliance disclaimer
paragraphs: Entry permissions are discretionary and may change without notice.

sections.title: Border decision factors
paragraphs: Officers assess purpose, length of stay, and evidence of ties to home country. Clear, consistent answers reduce risk.

sections.title: Extended FAQs
paragraphs: Short courses may be allowed, but long-term study typically requires a student visa.
No. Any work activity without authorization can lead to penalties.
Can I study short courses while visiting?
Is remote work allowed on tourist entry?
Can I study short courses while visiting? Short courses may be allowed, but long-term study typically requires a student visa.
Is remote work allowed on tourist entry? No. Any work activity without authorization can lead to penalties.

sections.title: State-specific entry logistics
paragraphs: Most arrivals route through the primary airport serving São Paulo, then continue to regional airports near São Paulo's major cities. Expect immigration checks, customs screening, and possible secondary inspection.
Arrival and passport control
Customs declaration and baggage screening
Domestic transfer (if needed)

sections.title: FAQs for travelers
paragraphs: Short-stay limits typically apply. Confirm the exact period for your nationality before travel.
Extensions are not automatic and may require local procedures before expiration.
Passport, proof of funds, return ticket, and accommodation confirmation.
How long can I stay?
Can I extend my stay?
What should I carry at the border?
How long can I stay? Short-stay limits typically apply. Confirm the exact period for your nationality before travel.
Can I extend my stay? Extensions are not automatic and may require local procedures before expiration.
What should I carry at the border? Passport, proof of funds, return ticket, and accommodation confirmation.
